intro: Miscanthus sinensis var. ionandros, commonly known as the silver feather reed grass, is a ornamental grass native to China. It features slender, arching stems that produce fluffy, silver-white plumes in the fall, adding visual interest to gardens. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are dark green with a silvery underside, creating a striking contrast. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and low maintenance requirements in landscaping.
